blog.name: skrullempire
blog.title: All Hail the Skrull Empire
blog.description: Daily (perhaps weekly) news and posts about the alien race created by Jack Kirby and Stan Lee: the Skrulls.

title: Debunking Theories: Skrulls among us?
body:
Ever since the Skrulls (a race of shapeshifting aliens) were introduced to the MCU, the fandom has gone nuts. Many delve in theories that claim one of our faves is, in fact, a mean extraterrestrial in disguise.


There are posts EVERYWHERE. Tumblr, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube you name it: it seems every Marvel fan has something to say and someone to blame for a potential Secret Invasion.


I’ve got to admit, some theories do make me refute my own beliefs. To me, Clint Barton is a Skrull since Thor 2010 and his family is a whole alien squad led by Queen Veranke, aka Laura herself. I highly doubt this would even be considered, but since everyone’s going crazy on the imagination, I’ll pull also my sleeves.


Still, don’t you think some theories might be… cinematically innacurate?


I mean, kudos to all of us for doubting 10 years of the Cinematic Universe! Nick Fury sure did teach us well in CATWS. Don’t trust anyone, remember? Good job.

What, then?!


First things first, let’s clarify the obvious: We’re talking about the Cinematic Universe, where comic conceptions aren’t accurately portrayed due to distinct universes. MCU is Earth 199999, not 616, aka comics mainstream.


What I do expect is, they will tweak the Skrull’s origins, their looks (as already done), their beliefs. It has to fit 10 years of movies. One thing that won’t change, though, is their goals. Every mean alien race wants to invade Earth to dominate it, or further yet, to destroy it. It’s unchangeable.

Although Captain Marvel 2019 dropped a trailer that didn’t answer anything (on the contrary, it raised more questions), we see them walking on a random beach Blink 182 style. So they’re coming, y’all. It’s a fact.


Who, then?!


STRAIGHT TO THE POINT, shall we?!

I believe the only ones that can be Skrulls are those whose minds weren’t toyed with by the Scarlet Witch. She’d know, right? Unless she’s a Skrull as well, and everybody is a Skrull because they succeeded on invading Earth and the reason Carol never showed up before is because she failed ohmygawd embrace change!


Why, of course, in the comics, the Skrulls go through a ritual in the so called Dard'van to be given memories, experiences and even feelings of the individuals they will impersonate. Some even start to believe they truly are the heroes they usurp.



However, I don’t believe the MCU would go that deep. Make it Clint as the only OG avenger who can possibly be a Skrull. Anyone other than Steve, Natasha, Bruce, Thor and Tony are up for grabs.


A proper list of possibilities would be:

  • Sam Wilson
  • Clint Barton
  • Scott Lang
  • Peter Parker
  • T’challa Udaku
  • Shuri Udaku
  • Hope Van Dyne
  • Pepper Potts
  • Jane Foster
  • Hank Pym
  • Janet Van Dyne (but, uh, that’d be stupid given circumstances)
  • Sharon Carter
  • Maria Hill
  • Anyone from agents of SHIELD who isn’t an Inhuman (Skrulls have awful side effects to the terrigens)
  • Anyone who’s never died
  • Literally any other secondary.


Wait. Anyone who’s never died?


Yep! Skrulls go back to their original shapes when they die. Only death or their own free will can reveal their true selves. This is important information.



Let’s finish this post with a list of people that cannot be Skrulls if we consider this article as a pinpoint.

  • Tony Stark
  • Thor Odinson
  • Loki Laufeyson
  • Natasha Romanoff
  • Wanda Maximoff
  • Steve Rogers
  • Bruce Banner
  • Phil Coulson
  • Daisy Johnson
  • Nick Fury


See, Nick is one of many names that are mentioned as potential fakes from theories all over around.

The only two reasons I beg to differ is, why would a Skrull bring together a group of remarkable people to protect the place he wants to invade? Second: Nick kinda “died” in CATWS, and although it was a fake induced death by chemicals, who knows? It’s a risk a Skrull wouldn’t take.



Or is it?



Enough debunking theories for today. Pretty sure most of you are now biting your nails trying to settle down this much information, because so am I. Therefore, let’s not bite the dust, alright? It may be the ashes of a deceased Avenger.


We’re not even sure a Secret Invasion arc is being considered, to say the least. Our heroes have already been through waaaay too many “who do you trust” situations already, first with HYDRA hiding among SHIELD (CATWS 2014) and with the Avengers disbanding during Civil War 2016.



Tell me what you think, yeah? I’d love to know your opinions regarding my own. Friendly reminder you can ask me anything! I’m always willing to explain things and be taught things I still don’t know. Thanks for the attention!

summary: Captain Marvel Actress Brie Larson Receives Backlash Over Instagram Tribute To Stan Lee
title: Captain Marvel Actress Brie Larson Receives Backlash Over Instagram Tribute To Stan Lee
body:
Captain Marvel Actress Brie Larson Receives Backlash Over Instagram Tribute To Stan Lee

Captain Marvel actress Brie Larson put out a tribute to the late, great Stan Lee, but quickly deleted the photo after she received fan backlash

In a now-deleted Instagram post, the Captain Marvel actress posted a photo of herself holding up what looks like some kind of mixed drink. She captioned the photo saying, “Thinking about Stan. What a legend. R.I.P.”

It seems that she may have felt the…

View On WordPress

AVENGE US CAPTAIN MARVEL!!!

music books tv and browsing the internet

About me: I’m an infj and a Slytherin Cause I’m with you till the end of the line- James Buchanan Barnes

Never be afraid to be who you really are

“We’re here, we’re queer, and we’re filled with existential fear -Daniel Howell

“Take it easy guys gals and non-binary pals”

-Thomas Sanders

body:
Homework

Probably my favorite assignment I did for my psychology class last year was the people watching assignment. I decided to go rewatch avengers infinity war and I used the reactions of the people around me as my research for my paper. There was a group of elderly ladies who were going to watch infinity war and one of them was like oh well we got here late because my da** husband drove too slow so we can’t watch that chick flick movie lets go watch infinity war instead and they were all cheering. It was hilarious. My problem was when I went to my seat the guy two seats over would not shut up the entire movie and had to make comments on every little line that was said especially any funny thing said by tony stark that drove me nuts! I did end up getting an A on the project but honestly I just used it to get my parents to let me rewatch at the theater.

title: Obituary: Stan Lee (28 December 1922 – 12 November 2018)
excerpt: When we woke up this morning, our favourite cameo man Stan Lee, best known being seen in Marvel Studios’ Doctor Strange (2016) as a bus commuter when Stephen Strange and Karl Mordo were chase…
description:
Many of us know Stan Lee so much until we read the news about him.

Yesterday morning, he passed at the age of 95, which saddened the entire Marvel community currently waiting for Marvel Studios’ Captain Marvel to be released in the movie theatres. He will be generally missed.

Excelsior!

title: Obituary: Stan Lee (28 December 1922 - 12 November 2018)
body:
Remembering @TheRealStanLee (28 December 1922 - 12 November 2018)

https://twitter.com/TheRealStanLee/status/1062078268319268864

When we woke up this morning, our favourite cameo man Stan Lee, best known being seen in Marvel Studios’ Doctor Strange (2016) as a bus commuter when Stephen Strange and Karl Mordo were chased down on the streets in New York by the zealots, has passed away at the age of 95 yesterday.

Stan Lee in Doctor Strange (Source: The Walt Disney…

My fannish space, where I ramble about everything and nothings. And although, yes, it's fannish space, and I'll squee and yay about said fandoms, I also take certain things very seriously so someties, I will post about it.  
I'm Méxican, I'm a woman, I'm an english teacher and an editor so a bit of everything shows up here.

title: Upperdeck's Marvel Masterpieces 2018 cards
body:
Upperdeck’s Marvel Masterpieces 2018 cards

This year I was honored to work in the Marvel Masterpieces 2018 card set put out by Upperdeck with 59 cards. I can’t tell you how much I squeed the second I got the cards, and how hard it was to pick JUST 59 characters because Marvel is probably my favorite Superhero comic universe of all time.

So here are 27 of those 59 cards (c’mon, I have to leave some to surprise anyone who gets them in their…

View On WordPress
